result.reason: Crash when closing a panel with active connection tabs — likely a guard condition gap in ConnectionWindow.Connection_FormClosing() or ClosePanelIfEmptyOnUiTick() causing ObjectDisposedException or NullReferenceException during panel/tab disposal race.
result.approach: Add null/disposed guards around connDock.Documents iteration in Connection_FormClosing(), ensure silentClose flag is set before iterating tabs, and protect ClosePanelIfEmptyOnUiTick() against disposed connDock state when panel close is user-initiated rather than tab-removal-triggered.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on the codebase analysis, issue #1794 (crash when closing a panel containing a connection tab) is a real bug in `ConnectionWindow.cs` — the `Connection_FormClosing()` or `ClosePanelIfEmptyOnUiTick()` logic has edge cases where guard conditions don't fully prevent ObjectDisposedException or NullReferenceException when the panel close races with tab disposal.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"Crash when closing a panel with active connection tabs — likely a guard condition gap in ConnectionWindow.Connection_FormClosing() or ClosePanelIfEmptyOnUiTick() causing ObjectDisposedException or NullReferenceException during panel/tab disposal race.","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionWindow.cs","mRemoteNG/UI/Tabs/ConnectionTab.cs"],"approach":"Add null/disposed guards around connDock.Documents iteration in Connection_FormClosing(), ensure silentClose flag is set before iterating tabs, and protect ClosePanelIfEmptyOnUiTick() against disposed connDock state when panel close is user-initiated rather than tab-removal-triggered."}
```
